intro: Centaurea patula, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive central purple or black disc, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Centaurea patula is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
